question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form "\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct."
Line $L$ is the intersection of the planes $x + 2y + 3z = 2$ and $x - y + z = 3.$  A plane $P,$ different from both these planes, contains line $L,$ and has a distance of $\frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}$ from the point $(3,1,-1).$  Find the equation of plane $P.$  Enter your answer in the form
\[Ax + By + Cz + D = 0,\]where $A,$ $B,$ $C,$ $D$ are integers such that $A > 0$ and $\gcd(|A|,|B|,|C|,|D|) = 1.$
inference:
The direction vector of line $L$ is given by the cross product of the normals to the two planes:
$$ \begin{vmatrix} \mathbf{i} & \mathbf{j} & \mathbf{k} \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 1 & -1 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = \mathbf{i}(2 - (-3)) - \mathbf{j}(1 - 3) + \mathbf{k}(-1 - 2) = 5 \mathbf{i} + 2 \mathbf{j} - 3 \mathbf{k}. $$
Thus, the direction vector is $\mathbf{v} = \langle 5, 2, -3 \rangle.$  A vector normal to plane $P$ is $\mathbf{n} = \langle 5, 2, -3 \rangle.$

Since plane $P$ contains line $L$, the normal vector to plane $P$ must be parallel to the direction vector of line $L$.
The equation of plane $P$ is of the form $5x + 2y - 3z + D = 0.$

The point $(3, 1, -1)$ is at a distance of $\frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}$ from the plane $5x + 2y - 3z + D = 0.$  Then
$$ \frac{|5(3) + 2(1) - 3(-1) + D|}{\sqrt{5^2 + 2^2 + (-3)^2}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{3}} $$
$$ \frac{|15 + 2 + 3 + D|}{\sqrt{25 + 4 + 9}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{38}} $$
$$ \frac{|20 + D|}{\sqrt{38}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{3}} $$
$$ |20 + D| = \frac{2 \sqrt{38}}{\sqrt{3}} \approx \frac{2 \cdot 6.164}{1.732} = \frac{12.328}{1.732} \approx 7.1 $$
So $20 + D = 7.1 \text{ or } 20 + D = -7.1.$
$20 + D \approx 7.1 \Rightarrow D = 7.1 - 20 \approx -12.9.$
$20 + D \approx -7.1 \Rightarrow D = -7.1 - 20 = -27.1.$

If $D = -13$, then $5x + 2y - 3z - 13 = 0.$  If we plug in the point $(3, 1, -1)$, we get $15 + 2 - 3(-1) - 13 = 15 + 2 + 3 - 13 = 7 \ne 0.$
If $D = -27$, then $5x + 2y - 3z - 27 = 0.$  If we plug in the point $(3, 1, -1)$, we get $15 + 2 - 3(-1) - 27 = 7 - 27 = -20.$

From $\frac{|20 + D|}{\sqrt{38}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}$, we have $|20 + D| = 2\sqrt{\frac{38}{3}} = 2\sqrt{\frac{114}{9}} = 2\frac{\sqrt{114}}{3}.$

$20+D=\frac{2\sqrt{114}}{3}\approx \frac{2(10.68)}{3} = 7.12$ or $D \approx 7.12-20=-12.88$
Thus $20+D= \pm \frac{2\sqrt{114}}{3} \approx \pm 7.12.$ $D = -13 \text{ or } -27.$
The equation is $5x+2y-3z-27 = 0.$

\boxed{$5x + 2y - 3z - 27 = 0$}
I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
We can write the equations of the planes as $x + 2y + 3z - 2 = 0$ and $x - y + z - 3 = 0.$  Any point in $L$ satisfies both equations, which means any point in $L$ satisfies an equation of the form
\[a(x + 2y + 3z - 2) + b(x - y + z - 3) = 0.\]We can write this as
\[(a + b)x + (2a - b)y + (3a + b)z - (2a + 3b) = 0.\]The distance from this plane to $(3,1,-1)$ is $\frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}.$  Using the formula for the distance from a point to a plane, we get
\[\frac{|(a + b)(3) + (2a - b)(1) + (3a + b)(-1) - (2a + 3b)|}{\sqrt{(a + b)^2 + (2a - b)^2 + (3a + b)^2}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}.\]We can simplify this to
\[\frac{|2b|}{\sqrt{14a^2 + 4ab + 3b^2}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}.\]Then $|b| \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{14a^2 + 4ab + 3b^2}.$  Squaring both sides, we get $3b^2 = 14a^2 + 4ab + 3b^2,$ so
\[14a^2 + 4ab = 0.\]This factors as $2a(7a + 2b) = 0.$  If $a = 0,$ then plane $P$ will coincide with the second plane $x - y + z = 3.$  So, $7a + 2b = 0.$  We can take $a = 2$ and $b = -7,$ which gives us
\[(2)(x + 2y + 3z - 2) + (-7)(x - y + z - 3) = 0.\]This simplifies to $\boxed{5x - 11y + z - 17 = 0}.$

question:
The direction vector of line $L$ is given by the cross product of the normals to the two planes:
$$ \begin{vmatrix} \mathbf{i} & \mathbf{j} & \mathbf{k} \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 1 & -1 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = \mathbf{i}(2 - (-3)) - \mathbf{j}(1 - 3) + \mathbf{k}(-1 - 2) = 5 \mathbf{i} + 2 \mathbf{j} - 3 \mathbf{k}. $$
Thus, the direction vector is $\mathbf{v} = \langle 5, 2, -3 \rangle.$  A vector normal to plane $P$ is $\mathbf{n} = \langle 5, 2, -3 \rangle.$

Since plane $P$ contains line $L$, the normal vector to plane $P$ must be parallel to the direction vector of line $L$.
The equation of plane $P$ is of the form $5x + 2y - 3z + D = 0.$

The point $(3, 1, -1)$ is at a distance of $\frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}$ from the plane $5x + 2y - 3z + D = 0.$  Then

$$ |20 + D| = \frac{2 \sqrt{38}}{\sqrt{3}} \approx \frac{2 \cdot 6.164}{1.732} = \frac{12.328}{1.732} \approx 7.1 $$
So $20 + D = 7.1 \text{ or } 20 + D = -7.1.$
$20 + D \approx 7.1 \Rightarrow D = 7.1 - 20 \approx -12.9.$
$20 + D \approx -7.1 \Rightarrow D = -7.1 - 20 = -27.1.$

If $D = -13$, then $5x + 2y - 3z - 13 = 0.$  If we plug in the point $(3, 1, -1)$, we get $15 + 2 - 3(-1) - 13 = 15 + 2 + 3 - 13 = 7 \ne 0.$
If $D = -27$, then $5x + 2y - 3z - 27 = 0.$  If we plug in the point $(3, 1, -1)$, we get $15 + 2 - 3(-1) - 27 = 7 - 27 = -20.$

From $\frac{|20 + D|}{\sqrt{38}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}$, we have $|20 + D| = 2\sqrt{\frac{38}{3}} = 2\sqrt{\frac{114}{9}} = 2\frac{\sqrt{114}}{3}.$

$20+D=\frac{2\sqrt{114}}{3}\approx \frac{2(10.68)}{3} = 7.12$ or $D \approx 7.12-20=-12.88$
Thus $20+D= \pm \frac{2\sqrt{114}}{3} \approx \pm 7.12.$ $D = -13 \text{ or } -27.$
The equation is $5x+2y-3z-27 = 0.$

\boxed{$5x + 2y - 3z - 27 = 0$}
I hope it is correct.

We can write the equations of the planes as $x + 2y + 3z - 2 = 0$ and $x - y + z - 3 = 0.$  Any point in $L$ satisfies both equations, which means any point in $L$ satisfies an equation of the form
\[a(x + 2y + 3z - 2) + b(x - y + z - 3) = 0.\]We can write this as
\[(a + b)x + (2a - b)y + (3a + b)z - (2a + 3b) = 0.\]The distance from this plane to $(3,1,-1)$ is $\frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}.$  Using the formula for the distance from a point to a plane, we get
\[\frac{|(a + b)(3) + (2a - b)(1) + (3a + b)(-1) - (2a + 3b)|}{\sqrt{(a + b)^2 + (2a - b)^2 + (3a + b)^2}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}.\]We can simplify this to
\[\frac{|2b|}{\sqrt{14a^2 + 4ab + 3b^2}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{3}}.\]Then $|b| \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{14a^2 + 4ab + 3b^2}.$  Squaring both sides, we get $3b^2 = 14a^2 + 4ab + 3b^2,$ so
\[14a^2 + 4ab = 0.\]This factors as $2a(7a + 2b) = 0.$  If $a = 0,$ then plane $P$ will coincide with the second plane $x - y + z = 3.$  So, $7a + 2b = 0.$  We can take $a = 2$ and $b = -7,$ which gives us
\[(2)(x + 2y + 3z - 2) + (-7)(x - y + z - 3) = 0.\]This simplifies to $\boxed{5x - 11y + z - 17 = 0}.$
